args: Shirley, what's going on?\nWhat are you doing here?
I followed you, together with the lullaflies.
That human is a threat to the kingdom.
Though I suppose you wouldn't understand,\nhaving been away your whole life.
He's not a THREAT! He's the nicest—
If your dear humans are so ＂nice,＂\nthen why was my sister butchered?!
I will never be free of that terrible day;\nI see it every time I close my eyes.
I'd just returned to my small size and was\npreparing to go home to the Faerie Kingdom.
But I was duped by humans and nearly had my\nwings snapped, until my older sister saved me.
Run, Shirley! And don't look back!
I ran to the kingdom for help, but by the\ntime they made it back, she was gone.\nAll that remained were her wings.
So I mastered the hidden technique to\nensure the same fate never befell any\nothers of my people.
Humans are feral beasts, yet our fool of\na king abetted them—and the putrid fruit\nof his sin is that man there!
If I'm supposed to be following that part,\nyou're gonna be real disappointed.
You need not understand. Suffice it to say\nyour friend there is a thing which cannot\nbe suffered to exist in this world.
Imagine my shock when the one you\nsought to protect was him, of all people!
Though you made finding him a simple\ntask, for which you have my thanks.
Now stand aside. I've no wish to hurt you.
Very well. If we must do this the hard way,\nI am prepared to see it through.
Well, you better strap on the battle gear,\ntoots, 'cause I'm not backing down!
Is that really your best? That blow carried\nall the weight of a mosquito.
I wish YOU'D make like a mosquito\nand buzz off already! Haaaah!
It is a cruel reality to realize one's strength\nis tied directly to their size.
That fact cost me my sister...
And today, it means your friend will die.
(I've gotta do something or all\nmy friends are gonna be toast!)
(My grown-up form is the only answer...)
I do hope you're not fool enough to think\nI'll just stand politely to the side and wait\nwhile you attempt to change forms.
You tried and failed, tried and failed...\nHundreds of times you tried and failed!\nYou are a tenacious thing, if nothing else.
This is my final warning, Notte:\nWalk away from these human wretches.\nMake a new home in the Faerie Kingdom.
We faeries live in different worlds,\nexperience time in different ways,\nand hold a different set of values.
We are happiest among our own.\nYou will come to know this in time.
Okay, sure. Maybe it IS best for faeries\nto live with other faeries...
But I want to be here with these people—\neven if it means fighting my own kind!
That's disappointing, Notte; I had hoped\nwe might become fast friends.
Still, it's best for you to sleep now;\nI don't wish you to see your friends die.
(I was useless to the very end...)
(I hate this... Why was I born so weak?)
Zethia! Notte! What are you doing here?\nI told you to wait at the castle!
You shouldn't try to do this alone.\nLet us help you!
Besides, we both know the only\nreason you benched us is so we could\ncome swooping in to save the day!
I was TRYING to protect you!\nYou both know these woods are home\nto all manner of terrible fiends!
Ugh! Protect us from what?\nThat dark prison of death we just\nbusted you out of?
She's right, Brother. We agreed on this.\nNo matter how trying the ordeal,\nthe three of us must face it together.

You're right. I was overconfident. And
there's no denying I could use the help.
Thank you, both of you. Now let's move
out—our goal is just ahead.
(Zethia and I followed him that day\nso we could keep our promise...)
(We promised that no matter how tough\nthings got, we'd always face it together.)
(I didn't break my promise then,\nand I'm not gonna do it now!)
And since I'm the only one still upright,\nthat means I have to protect everyone!
